triples.name: Backstepping
triples.relevance: Core control methodology used to design the containment control approach for nonlinear multiagent systems.

triples.name: Lyapunov function
triples.relevance: Foundation for analyzing system stability, extended through barrier Lyapunov functions to handle state constraints.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: Core framework for controlling nonlinear multiagent systems with state constraints.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Primary problem domain where the containment control approach with multiple leaders and followers is applied.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: Neural-approximation-based adaptive approach used to handle uncertain and time-varying parameters in the control system.

triples.name: Universal approximation theorem
triples.relevance: Theoretical basis for using neural networks to approximate unknown nonlinear functions in the adaptive controller.

triples.name: Filter (signal processing)
triples.relevance: First-order filters are introduced to reduce system communication burden while maintaining control performance.

triples.name: Event-driven architecture
triples.relevance: Event-triggered control mechanism balances system security, control accuracy, and resource consumption through switching-based design.

triples.name: Barrier method
triples.relevance: Novel barrier Lyapunov functions proposed to enforce state constraints while maintaining convergence guarantees.
